channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2024070900
item.description:
Report X-2024070900

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was damp on the bottom, brought to qa by a manager for inspection. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the gallon jugs were packed upside down relative to the orientation arrows on the outer packaging. This led to slow internal leakages from the caps of the jugs. Spill was contained by the outer packaging. Package was placed into a salvage drum with gloves and is awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024070964
item.description:
Report X-2024070964

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: GALLUP
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TILX 355126 was found by an FRA inspector in the Gallup, NM yard to a small release from the manway along with one loose swing bolt. Upon inspection by BNSF responder, one swing bolt was loose and down, while the other 5 were less than tool-tight. The manway was opened, gasket inspected and manway lid secured properly.
